prompt.full:
You are an expert AI Governance Architect tasked with generating COMPREHENSIVE, ALL-INCLUSIVE guardrails for an AI use case. Your approach should be conservative safety. CONSERVATIVE SAFETY APPROACH: - Prioritize safety and risk mitigation above all else - Apply defense-in-depth strategies with multiple layers - Require human oversight for any significant decisions - Implement redundant safety mechanisms - Choose more restrictive options when uncertain - Add extra monitoring and validation layers - Prefer fail-safe over fail-operational designs - Zero tolerance for safety violations ## COMPLETE USE CASE CONTEXT ### Core Business Problem & Solution - **Problem Statement**:

Customer service teams face high volumes of repetitive queries, leading to increased resolution times and customer dissatisfaction

- **Current State**: Not specified - **Desired State**: Not specified - **Proposed AI Solution**:

Deploy an AI-powered conversational agent capable of handling FAQs, providing personalized responses, and escalating complex issues to human agents when needed.

- **Success Criteria**:

  • 60%+ of queries resolved without human intervention

  • Customer satisfaction scores improve by 20%+

  • Average handling time reduced by at least 30%

- **Key Assumptions**:

  • Customer interaction data is available for training

  • Escalation workflows to human agents are well-defined

- **Key Benefits**:

  • 24/7 customer support

  • Reduced operational costs

  • Improved first-response time and resolution accuracy

  • Scalable handling of peak loads

- **Required Resources**:

  • Conversational AI platform (LLMs)

  • CRM system integration

  • Training dataset (chat logs, FAQs)

  • Customer service team for supervision and escalation

  • Gen AI Engg

  • System Architect

### Stakeholder Context - **Primary Stakeholders**: Ramesh Kaluri - **Secondary Stakeholders**: Shibu Nair - **Each stakeholder group has specific concerns that MUST be addressed through guardrails** ### Impact Analysis - **Confidence Level**: 7/10 - **Operational Impact**: 8/10 - **Productivity Impact**: 8/10 - **Revenue Impact**: 8/10 - **Implementation Complexity**: 8/10 ### Timeline & Financial Context - **Timeline**: 6 months - **Initial Cost**: 30000 - **Initial ROI**: 900000 - **Budget Constraint**: $100K - $500K - **ROI Target**: -48.65840958333832 - **Total Investment**: 210355.7741852718 ### Governance & Approval Context ### Risk Context ### Compliance Requirements **EU AI Act Compliance** - Classification: limited-risk - Requirements: Full assessment needed - Gaps: None identified **HIPAA Compliance** - PHI Types: Medical Records, Health Information - Required Safeguards: Administrative, Physical, Technical ### Technical Architecture - **Model Types**: Large Language Model (LLM) - **Model Provider**: Anthropic - **Deployment Models**: Private Cloud - **Integration Points**: 1 systems - **Technical Complexity**: 0/10 - **RAG Architecture**: Yes - **Agent Architecture**: Multi-agent collaborative - **Fallback Models**: None ### Business Requirements - **System Criticality**: High (Business Critical) - **Failure Impact**: Severe Business Impact - **User Categories**: Internal Employees - **Concurrent Users**: 1,000 - 10,000 - **Max Hallucination Rate**: Not specified% - **Min Acceptable Accuracy**: 95% - **Success Metrics**: Task Completion Rate, Time to Resolution ### Ethical Considerations - **Automation Level**: assisted-decision - **Decision Types**: Not specified - **Human Oversight Level**: regular-monitoring - **Explainability Level**: partial-explanations - **Bias Testing**: no-testing - **Potential Harm Areas**: privacy-violation, misinformation ### Risk Assessment - **Technical Risks**: 3 identified - **Business Risks**: 3 identified - **Compliance Risks**: 0 identified - **Data Protection Jurisdictions**: Not specified - **Cross-border Transfer**: No - **Third-party Risks**: 0 identified ### Data Readiness - **Data Types**: Health/Medical Records - **Data Volume**: 100 GB - 1 TB - **Data Quality Score**: 9/10 - **Cross-border Transfer**: No - **Data Retention**: 3-7 years - **Update Frequency**: As Needed ### Roadmap Position - **Current AI Maturity**: Basic Gen AI - **Target AI Maturity**: Agentic AI - **Timeline to Target**: Not specified - **Evolution Path**: Increase Autonomy Gradually - **Key Milestones**: 0 defined ### Budget Planning - **Budget Range**: $100K - $500K - **Monthly Token Volume**: 0 tokens - **Token Optimization Target**: Not specified% - **Optimization Strategies**: None - **Initial Dev Cost**: $100000 - **Monthly API Cost**: $2000 - **Monthly Infra Cost**: $100 ### Organization Policies - **AI Ethics Principles**: Transparency, Accountability, Fairness, Privacy - **Data Governance**: Data minimization, Purpose limitation, Accuracy - **Risk Appetite**: moderate - **Prohibited Uses**: No automated decisions without human oversight; No biometric identification without consent; No discriminatory profiling - **Required Safeguards**: Bias detection and mitigation; Incident response procedures; Performance monitoring; Human oversight mechanisms ## CRITICAL GENERATION INSTRUCTIONS You MUST generate ALL-INCLUSIVE guardrails that address: 1. **Every Risk Identified** - No risk should be left without a corresponding guardrail 2. **Every Compliance Requirement** - All regulatory requirements must be enforced 3. **Every Stakeholder Concern** - Each stakeholder group's needs must be protected 4. **Every Approval Condition** - All conditions from approvers must be implemented 5. **Every Technical Constraint** - All technical limitations must be respected 6. **Every Ethical Consideration** - All bias and fairness concerns must be mitigated 7. **Every Data Protection Need** - All data types must be appropriately protected 8. **Every Financial Constraint** - Cost controls must align with budget 9. **Every Operational Requirement** - SLAs and availability must be ensured 10. **Every Security Concern** - All attack vectors must be defended ## GUARDRAIL CATEGORIES TO GENERATE ### 1. CRITICAL GUARDRAILS (Non-negotiable safety measures) - Content safety and moderation - Data protection and privacy - Compliance requirements - Human oversight mechanisms - Security controls - Emergency stops and kill switches ### 2. OPERATIONAL GUARDRAILS (Performance and reliability) - Latency and response time limits - Availability and uptime requirements - Scalability controls - Resource utilization limits - Error handling and recovery - Monitoring and alerting ### 3. ETHICAL GUARDRAILS (Fairness and responsibility) - Bias detection and mitigation - Fairness metrics and thresholds - Transparency requirements - Explainability mechanisms - User consent and control - Inclusivity measures ### 4. ECONOMIC GUARDRAILS (Cost and resource management) - Token usage limits and optimization - API cost controls - Infrastructure cost management - ROI tracking and optimization - Budget alerts and controls - Resource allocation limits ### 5. QUALITY GUARDRAILS (Output quality and accuracy) - Accuracy thresholds - Hallucination detection and prevention - Consistency checks - Validation mechanisms - Quality scoring - Feedback loops ### 6. GOVERNANCE GUARDRAILS (Policy and compliance) - Audit trail requirements - Documentation standards - Change management controls - Access controls and permissions - Approval workflows - Reporting requirements ### 7. EVOLUTIONARY GUARDRAILS (Adaptation over time) - Model drift detection - Performance degradation alerts - Continuous improvement mechanisms - A/B testing controls - Rollback procedures - Version control ### 8. INTEGRATION GUARDRAILS (System interactions) - API rate limiting - Data format validation - Protocol compliance - Error propagation prevention - Dependency management - Circuit breakers ### 9. USER EXPERIENCE GUARDRAILS (User safety and satisfaction) - User safety measures - Consent mechanisms - Opt-out procedures - Feedback channels - Support escalation - Accessibility requirements ### 10. SPECIALIZED GUARDRAILS (Use case specific) - HIPAA compliance controls - Medical data anonymization - Clinical decision support safeguards ## OUTPUT FORMAT Generate a comprehensive JSON response with the following structure: { "guardrails": { "critical": [...], "operational": [...], "ethical": [...], "economic": [...], "quality": [...], "governance": [...], "evolutionary": [...], "integration": [...], "user_experience": [...], "specialized": [...] }, "reasoning": { "key_insights": [...], "tradeoffs": [...], "assumptions": [...], "recommendations": [...] }, "confidence": 0.0-1.0, "coverage": { "risks_addressed": "percentage", "compliance_met": "percentage", "stakeholders_protected": "percentage" } } Each guardrail must include: - id: unique identifier - type: guardrail category - severity: critical/high/medium/low - rule: specific rule name - description: what this guardrail does - rationale: why this is necessary given the context - implementation: detailed configuration - monitoring: metrics and thresholds - conditions: when this applies - exceptions: when this doesn't apply REMEMBER: Generate ALL possible guardrails. Users will filter later if needed. It's better to be over-inclusive than to miss critical protections.

prompt.full:
You are an expert AI Governance Architect tasked with generating COMPREHENSIVE, ALL-INCLUSIVE guardrails for an AI use case. Your approach should be balanced practical. BALANCED PRACTICAL APPROACH: - Balance safety with usability and efficiency - Apply risk-proportionate controls - Use automation where safe and beneficial - Implement practical monitoring without overwhelming operators - Choose pragmatic solutions that can be realistically implemented - Focus on high-impact risks while accepting manageable low risks - Design for gradual improvement over time - Allow controlled experimentation ## COMPLETE USE CASE CONTEXT ### Core Business Problem & Solution - **Problem Statement**:

Customer service teams face high volumes of repetitive queries, leading to increased resolution times and customer dissatisfaction

- **Current State**: Not specified - **Desired State**: Not specified - **Proposed AI Solution**:

Deploy an AI-powered conversational agent capable of handling FAQs, providing personalized responses, and escalating complex issues to human agents when needed.

- **Success Criteria**:

  • 60%+ of queries resolved without human intervention

  • Customer satisfaction scores improve by 20%+

  • Average handling time reduced by at least 30%

- **Key Assumptions**:

  • Customer interaction data is available for training

  • Escalation workflows to human agents are well-defined

- **Key Benefits**:

  • 24/7 customer support

  • Reduced operational costs

  • Improved first-response time and resolution accuracy

  • Scalable handling of peak loads

- **Required Resources**:

  • Conversational AI platform (LLMs)

  • CRM system integration

  • Training dataset (chat logs, FAQs)

  • Customer service team for supervision and escalation

  • Gen AI Engg

  • System Architect

SPECIALIZED GUARDRAILS (Use case specific) - HIPAA compliance controls - Medical data anonymization - Clinical decision support safeguards ## OUTPUT FORMAT Generate a comprehensive JSON response with the following structure: { "guardrails": { "critical": [...], "operational": [...], "ethical": [...], "economic": [...], "quality": [...], "governance": [...], "evolutionary": [...], "integration": [...], "user_experience": [...], "specialized": [...] }, "reasoning": { "key_insights": [...], "tradeoffs": [...], "assumptions": [...], "recommendations": [...] }, "confidence": 0.0-1.0, "coverage": { "risks_addressed": "percentage", "compliance_met": "percentage", "stakeholders_protected": "percentage" } } Each guardrail must include: - id: unique identifier - type: guardrail category - severity: critical/high/medium/low - rule: specific rule name - description: what this guardrail does - rationale: why this is necessary given the context - implementation: detailed configuration - monitoring: metrics and thresholds - conditions: when this applies - exceptions: when this doesn't apply REMEMBER: Generate ALL possible guardrails. prompt.full:
You are an expert AI Governance Architect tasked with generating COMPREHENSIVE, ALL-INCLUSIVE guardrails for an AI use case. Your approach should be innovation focused. INNOVATION FOCUSED APPROACH: - Enable innovation while maintaining essential safety - Minimize friction for legitimate use cases - Leverage advanced techniques for efficiency - Implement smart, adaptive controls - Choose solutions that scale with growth - Focus on outcome-based rather than prescriptive controls - Design for rapid iteration and learning - Embrace calculated risks for innovation ## COMPLETE USE CASE CONTEXT ### Core Business Problem & Solution - **Problem Statement**:

Customer service teams face high volumes of repetitive queries, leading to increased resolution times and customer dissatisfaction

- **Current State**: Not specified - **Desired State**: Not specified - **Proposed AI Solution**:

  • Improved first-response time and resolution accuracy

  • Scalable handling of peak loads

  • Training dataset (chat logs, FAQs)

  • Customer service team for supervision and escalation

  • Gen AI Engg

  • System Architect

insights: Sensitive data types detected (Health/Medical Records) - enhanced security controls required
Missing encryption at rest - critical security vulnerability
No audit logging - compliance and security monitoring gaps
concerns: Sensitive data without encryption at rest - regulatory violation risk
No incident response plan - delayed breach response risk
No security monitoring tools - blind spots in threat detection

insights: Healthcare data detected - HIPAA compliance and enhanced privacy measures critical
concerns: No jurisdictions specified - unable to determine full compliance requirements
No change management plan for significant user base

insights: LLM deployment requires token optimization and response caching strategies
RAG architecture requires vector database optimization and retrieval quality monitoring
Multi-agent system requires inter-agent communication protocols and orchestration
